item.title: Dumped pile of meat, 15th June
item.description:
A rancid pile of meat and bones has been dumped behind the odd numbers houses on Brangbourne Road. The police have been involved and have cleared it for removal. It is now getting very hot and invites wildlife, flies and maggots. It is also going to rot and smell.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brangbourne Road, Southend, London

item.title: Over grown tree, 15th June
item.description:
46 Castleton Road tree is over grown and coming in my garden . I have three children with all under line health issues Can’t let my son in the garden due to having a major head surgery what I have proof of. Scared due to branch falling in the garden and could hit him . Daughters has major allergies so she can not go out as tree pollen and tree sap goes over all the garden . Youngest daughter as found 5 stag Beatles in the garden . I have to clear the garden once a week as every thing falls in my garden . Over the winter I’m collecting branches and leafs and this is not even my tree . I can’t put this in the bin so I’m paying to take these to the tip or get collected. Bin lorry’s are hitting these tree every Monday and now worried this will happen and someone will get hurt . This needs looking at right away as at there rear is a drive way to others residents. If needed I can send in proof of children doctors note and hospital to provide proof why this needs to be down as a matter of urgency

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castleton Road, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of broken glass outside garages and litter and detritus in channel headings., 15th June
item.description:
Windsor.Terrace/Buxton Court - opposite cycle hire station. There is broken glass outside the garages - this has caused punctures to tyres. There is also a large amount of glass, litter and detritus build up. This area seems to be neglected.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Thoresby Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Salt bin used as a rubbish bin on castor street by Tayo Situ house, 15th June
item.description:
Hi there, there is a salt bin on the corner of Cator street and commercial way that is always full of litter. Its better than rubbish being on the street but could this be cleaned up? An actual bin would be great in this area. Thanks for all the great work you do.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Commercial Way, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard’s at bottom of Broomwood Rd vandalised, 15th June
item.description:
Bollard is on verge outside 88 Sevenoaks Way. Wondering where it was from, a bit further along it was part of the island at the bottom of Broomwood Rd. Someone has yanked it of and removed it. Not sure if the electrics are damaged.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Sevenoaks Way, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
